comments.body: Makes sense

Should be in villages, not caves. And their nests shouldn't be edible (it's swifts that people eat the nests of, not sparrows).
Disney

good idea!
Sea otters are animals to add to Minecraft!
we need otters i love otters and would fit in so much
although under the sea there's a bunch of life the top is is bland, I think its a great idea to give it some life and make it cute too! this needs to happen.

**Sea otters could require being fed sea urchins to breed (assuming such are also added are added).
*Sea urchins could be baby-rabbit-sized, and spawn on the ocean floor near kelp.

**Sea otters would spawn in kelp forests in all ocean biomes that kelp naturally spawn in.

**Baby sea otters should be "wrapped" in kelp (float without moving only where kelp reaches the ocean surface) to be able to grow to adults.
maybe they eat (and hold) fish! it will be sooooooooooo cute!
Pls do it
If you feed a cub meat you should be able to tame it, but you can't tame an adult.
also their not hostile
yea but just make it so they're not hostile because mojang won't add hostile real world mobs as of now.
This would be a great idea! Maybe you could put a carpet on it just like with a llama and then put a saddle on as well so you could control where the llama would go. That would make them much cooler.
I would add the camels to the game because the desert has almost no stuff, it's very empty! my hope is that in the future they will add them!
Maybe the camels can be milked with buckets (I'm sure there is camel milk in real life.)
it should be able to have 2 players riding it
Ooooooh! https://twitter.com/Minecraft/status/1581333673768386560?s=20&t=CujrpNg4D5d4lQtqOrVBLA

it must be cute tho
Maybe ferrets would retrieve your items, like you have a stack of iron and the ferret can retrieve your stack and carry it home

Ferrets would actually be a plains-exclusive mob, since black-footed ferrets naturally live in the Great Plains, and the plains are incredibly boring in-game despite their diverse wildlife in real life. Black-footed ferrets only have one color/marking variation (black-footed, obviously), but since they would be tameable in the game, they would most likely have the same color/marking variations that domesticated ferrets do, right? Sable (most common in real life), black, panda, dark-eyed white, etc. Maybe even a rarer albino variation?

Since ferrets are obligate carnivores, mostly eating rodents in the real world, raw rabbit would be a good way to tame them. Or maybe a rabbit's foot, if you wanted it to be a little harder. I personally imagine that they would act more similarly to foxes rather than cats, since wild ferrets are obviously.. well, more wild than cats. Either way, I think this would be a pretty good idea! If the Minecraft devs wanted something a little more general than ferrets, weasels would be a good alternative! There are a lot of different weasel species out there, so they could be located in more diverse biomes than ferrets could be, and they could still be tamed like ferrets would be (hey, if it's moral to tame wolves, foxes, and ocelots, it's okay to tame weasels).

I have 4 ferrets currently, and have had 5 ferrets in my lifetime (one died of old age), ferrets are awesome creatures and are just like combinations of dogs & cats. I really suggest adding them! (They also come in many different colors so add that to)
That would hint you're supposed to kill them lol, you aren't. You should leave the bees, sea turtles, and dolphins alone ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

I agree. They are so useless and need something. It's great that dolphins lead you to treasure, so instead of copying that, they should have an instigated behavior that matches wolves. You should be able to get wings to repair your elytra for more than what leather does or have them drop stingers for a new potion or quicker way to brew an existing one.

Bees should spread flower seeds. Making the flowers spread. Happier Bees! Now, we needs Bears? Some natural enemy to the Bees. Bears steal honey and hoard it in a cave. Loot for players if they find it.
maybe a bee stinger
maybe a bee stinger
What about a makeshift elytra
Potreste fargli lasciare un pungiglione-freccia da usare con arco o balestra o altrimenti come il tridente
It could be fun to get a stinger then put it on your sword and have more attack damage

They should rarely drop a bee wing on death. The bee wing is only collected when not killed by player. The bee wing can be used to craft low quality "bee wings" which is elytra with low durability and cannot be used with fireworks

What do you get after killing a bee IRL? Apart from pain not a lot just like in Minecraft, bees are THICC just to make it easy to spot and transport them. You better of leaving them alone and trying to live in prace with them
They should drop honeycombs
they should drop pollen

Noo the message we should be trying to spread is not ‚Äúkill bees, and good things will happen‚Äù we should be trying to help them, especially now because irl they are in danger! I agree that as of now they don‚Äôt really have a purpose outside of aesthetics, but maybe it could be like ‚Äúhelp the bees and good things will happen‚Äù  Maybe if you plant a specific type of flower that is relatively hard to get around your garden, you could cause a beehive to spawn.  Having a beehive in the area that you have spawned (so that you can‚Äôt just go to an existing beehive without getting the specific flower) makes all plants within a certain radius grow a little faster.  That way it would be like ‚Äúhelping the bee population grow = good because they help you back with growing crops‚Äù
no, they most definitely shouldn't. mojang wont add anything that encourages the act of killing endangered species
Giving them drops would encourage killing them... to be clear, killing them is discouraged. They have plenty of uses when they're alive.
Since you say the whale could teleport the enderman should have cages that stop the teleportation of something that way they could never escape.
Perhaps they could be offered chorus flowers to be ridden between islands for a short time?

Flying whales always seemed like a cool addition to flesh out the void in the end, some huge creature living between the islands. It could be rideable as well and possibly have resources to craft elytra. Possibly giving more functionallity to spyglasses in that it could make it easier to spot a flying whale (since they should be super rare)

Would there be a use in flying after it, over the void, with an Elytra--perhaps, as awful as this is, to poach it? It could drop some rare and new item, considering how difficult it would be to kill AND retrieve the loot before it vanishes forever into the void?
Poaching a whale is reprehensible on all levels, even if it is a flying space whale. It should drop nothing.

They appear after the death of the dragon and calmly, measuredly fly (‚Äúfloat‚Äù in the air), after the dragon is revived, they despawn again. While swimming, they sing and the sounds of the ocean are slightly heard near them (as in different videos on You tube). If you hit the whale, it just despawns, they can be lured by the chorus, saddled and floated. End whales that are not saddled are translucent, because They represent the ghosts of the animals that lived here before the appearance of the dragon. A saddled whale becomes opaque (as if materializing). The colors of the whales are in the style of the Edge, soft and calm. Endermen are afraid of them and teleport when they approach. Whales do not swim close to the cities of the region (are they afraid of shulkers and / or those who sailed on the ships of the End before?). This innovation will not be an imbalance in the extraction of elytra, because whales appear only after killing the dragon and do not move very quickly, but it will create an additional atmosphere in the End and make Steve and Alex return to the Land in between battles, construction and mining to think about the eternal, swimming on whales and listening to their thanksgiving singing for freeing from the dragon. This will be a logical addition to the backstory of the End, since there are ships in the land, so there is where to sail! Whales with their singing in endless space will very well approach the atmosphere of the region, after its release.
And bedrock but you should add end villagers like the nether zombie piglens
porpur could be the name (porpoise + purpur) or end thresher.
Love it! Hope this gets implemented; the end is so overdue for an update...
How about a rideable/tamable end whale? I am determined to make this a thing!
What if at night it shines as bright as the moon?
Pupur porpoise is my name!
What do you mean by size is tied to the phases of the moon?
It means "Larger in new moons and smaller in full moons".
Maybe not make them smaller during full moons?
Well, slimes already use the moon, this could be a reason to look up which is appropriate, and would add a new layer of strategy to when you want to go exploring.

I agree, also, the parrot should only mimic a mob when it's visible by the player/parrot. I'm getting tired of my parrot squawking at me when the zombie is just underground and i'm above ground. AND PLEASE MAKE IT SO THE PARROT DOESN'T HOP OFF YOUR SHOULDER WHEN YOU JUMP. Make it like a Shift+Right click hotkey or something.

Yeah, it'd be really nice to be able to move around without your Parrot jumping off your shoulder all the time.

There should at least be an option for a hotkey, or having shift - jump or something kicking them off. And I think it's also fair to have them jump off when you get damaged, and maybe if you fall a certain distance or something.

I would also like it if you could heal parrots with seeds because I have lost parrots for far too long and I don't want to head to another jungle to replace them. I would also like parrots to avoid landing on hazards.

1. They shouldn't just fall off when you fall two blocks. When they're on your shoulders, you should have to click a button to get them off.
2. Healing them would be a wonderful feature. They die so easily and it's heartbreaking when you've done so much work to find them and they die on the way home.
3. Being able to breed them, like you do any other passive mob, would not only make sense but make the game more... Fun? Baby parrots would be awesome.
4. More variety in colors? If not in parrots, maybe add other bird types.
Needs changing definately. Maybe with the introduction of Toocans.
I really want them to add Anteaters, considering they are adding Termites :)

Yea, the giant anteater would be perfect for jungle biomes. It would be tamed with termites and could be ridden. It would be about as slow as a pig when ridden. While on its back, when you attack, it will swing its claw doing additional damage and removing any leaves and grass in its way. Babies would also ride on the mothers back like in real life. I hope people see this comment so we can get these loveable creatures in the game.
This is so cool! Anteaters would be great for jungles
Taming them would be cool, but riding them I'm not so sure about. But I like your idea, you got my vote!
More information: they breed with plants, which could mean anything from seeds to fruit. They could have different genders.

(just adding on)

The leader of the troop is called the silver back. You can distinguish him from other gorillas by him being larger. From time to time it will also beat his chest. If you hit one, they all retaliate. they spawn in groups of 3-7, with always one silverback. You can obtain bananas from jungle leaves, similarly to how you can get apples from oak leaves. If a gorilla is fed enough bananas, with perhaps some meat or other food to finish off with, and making sure you have spent enough time together, you can earn the troop's trust. They can protect you, just like foxes do when they trust you.

The silverback has 50 hp (25 hearts), and deals 10 damage (5 hearts) to the target. The other gorillas have 30 hp (15 hearts) and deal 6 damage (3 hearts). It has no drops so players won't be encouraged to kill them (they are endangered)

Is it okay to post this so it can get more views, therefore votes?
gorillas are my favorite animal so I voted this!
I think dwarves should live in caves and goblins live in the dark forest but either way that's a cool idea.
Yessss he also has to be super powerful and drop emeralds when he goes to Valhalla.
I absolutely love this concept!  But yes,  I do agree with 403274540331 on this one
yeah this is a great idea :)

These would be so cool in the big caves if they had a small village. One thing that always irked me about piglins is where the heck do they live? Underground villages with mobs that are sometimes friendly sometimes hostile sounds awesome

Cool idea, I would also add the opportunity to mske him angry and happy so when you hit it it will become angry but when you feed him an apple he will be friendly again and trades diamonds and gold (only the good stuff). He can only be found in taiga and dark forest
yeah, its kinda sad trying to make a nether hub rn, at least the piglins need light level 11, would be nice that the same aplied to the Hoglins
Agreed, hate having hostile mobs spawn inside my base in the Nether.
yeah that's a + from me

100% agree. I actually just started building my nether outpost for potion crafting in the crimson forest. All was well until I realized I couldnt stop the hoglins from spawning inside the base (ON HALF BLOCK FLOORS) üò© literally just started searching for answers and apparently nether wart blocks and magma blocks are the only blocks known that they cant spawn on. I believe that they shouldn't be able to spawn on half blocks ! Idk about lighting cause some people use them as a breed able food source. But players should be able to spawn proof their homes at the very least.!

I'm currently playing single biome of Crimson Forest and Hoglins ARE spawning on half slabs. Not sure if its a bug with just single biome since its Crimson Forest in the Overworld. But only thing that stops them from spawning are the Nether Wart Blocks and Shroomlights.

I am late as heck here but this definitely should be looked into. Slabs everywhere make the Nether look ugly, and the nether update was supposed to make it more convienient to live in it, but why even bother if the mobs can spawn literally everywhere in any light level unless there are certain blocks placed in every single space possible xdd
Maybe, I like the idea, but foxes aren't very strong. How about they can hunt for you and can lead you to food sources?
I mean you can have fox‚Äôs trust..
Maybe not the exact same qualities as a wolf, but it'd be awesome if you could tame them!
foxes are passive mobs so they will not be able to kill other mobs they can only kill the chicken and rabbit
Mojang should add this . I walked 7000 blocks just for finding a fox and i cant tame it .
That's too many golems. Who heard of a crying obsidian  golem? Or an bed golem? PUMPKIN GOLEM?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?! As I said, too many.
399887718571 Mabye not for beds but wart golems could be cool.
Well, it's a known fact that that we need more golems in the game. More varieties of them. More materials to make them from, and so on.

Maybe being able to make Blaze Golems and Guardian Golems, since they aren't natural mobs. It would be really cool if we could make these 2 mobs, that would help us; obviously they would require special items to be made
Fr I would love to have the redstone golem coming to the game, and more , imagine a flying or aquatic golem ü§Ø
TNT Golem , would be pretty similar to a creeper but on our side

Any new golem should have usability for most players. Now Tuff & Copper showed some neat "cool down" mechanics are perfect for what more useful golems should be modeled with to do the following functions:

Guarding-(gloom-like) This golem will patrol around the edge of a lite area and will alarm at nearby hostiles, summoning Iron or snow golems (possibly a new ranged attack golem) it may periodically just chill in a spot. It can be led by a lead but will only alter at hostiles if in a lite area, making it a useful mob to watch your back when solo mining.

Automaters- these golems will tackle grinding tasks for players and have a maintenance or cool-down need to ensure players check up on them. Fishing, Farming, Lumber harvesting (log block breaker), Cobblestone block breaker, and Item sorting; are all tasks players would love to automate, and that could be balanced by golems that do cool-downs or need maintenance periodically. 

Attacking/Defense- this is mostly filled already but; an improved ranged or smart turret that could be limited by actual ammo consumption (buffed by being able to toss potions) and a shield/wall golem that is 2 tall and will move in front of ranged hostiles to block their shots are two niches that need a golem. Beyond ways to improve Iron or Snow which seems unlikely to happen.
They need to add Tuff and Copper!

Even if there's only ONE new golem, I would like it to have range and do even just *half a heart per shot?*

Snow golem towers are useless against ranged mobs, they just die. They do nothing to melee mobs but annoy them. They're only good for snow.

even if it's something stupid like a potato throwing golem, as long as it's ranged and does even small damage, i shalleth be happyeth.
what about a composter golem? you could fill it with a vegetable for example a potato and it would be ranged but if you put in a carrot, it would be melee.
Me gustaria que agregaran un golem que te ayude a sembrar un huerto y darles de comer a los animales que tienes
On one hand I'd love to see my parrots multiply themselves, but on the other it would take away the challenge of going out to jungles to get parrots. Yes I want it but I also don't.
Baby parrots don't have feathers, but baby chickens aren't yellow and don't chirp so I don't see a problem with this idea.
Honestly, it's stupid that we don't have this yet. Not sure why we don't. It seems like something that is a no brainer.
it would be nice a mini breeding system, put a nest to the parrots and that they lay eggs and that they are born at the same time, something similar to the mechanics of the turtles.
Mojang please add the baby parrot with the new baby mob designs the parrot should able to breed and have a new baby mob with the different type of parrots

in real life I bet it's difficult to breed parrots in captivity so maybe if it was possible there needs to be a lot of conflictions like only in a jungle biome and only between two parrots that look exactly the same, and it would take a long time just like turtle breeding.

laying just one egg that only makes the same color variant, so parrot are still rare or you still need to adventure to find different colors.
There should at least be 3 homeless bees for this to happen and should take about 1-2 minecraft days.

This would completely contradict the game's current gameplay, where if you break a beehive, the bees sting you and then they die. Would you be suggesting that bees don't sting you if you break their hive? Also, what happens if you place a block where the original bee nest was. Lastly, this would ruin the purpose of bee nests, which is currently the only use for honeycomb besides blocks.
I like the idea of homeless bees building hives.
Would this mean that homeless bees would randomly pathfind around a general area? What materials would they gather (pollen, wood stuff, other things)?
Great idea "SHOTFIRE OMEGA"! I also agree that the bees should physically gather materials for the nest!

I agree. I would understand if these bushes grew flowers and the bees pollenated them so they could produce the berries but because theres no flower to that bush, and the bees mostly are only attracted to flowers in the game it doesn‚Äôt make sense for them to get hurt by the bush.
Also rose bushes have thorns‚Ä¶. So bees should just be immune to thorns

It wouldn't be so bad if bees weren't attracted to them, but their pathfinding seems to lead them towards them. In my taiga village, I had three or four beehives next to my crop field, surrounded by 40+ poppies and rose bushes and other flowers that I hoped they'd attempt to pollinate first. Despite this the bees would still sometimes travel to sweet berry bushes many blocks further away along the border of the village - or even in the forest on the other side of my tall fence - and eventually they'd all die. It was really sad and just made it impossible to keep free-roaming bees there at all.
it should be like the one in minecraft dungeons tho
Its on minecraft dungeons but he is hostile
This is actually a really good idea. Unlike a lot of other dragon suggestions,I‚Äôm sold. Keep up the good work
nice

I love the idea except for one thing. I think the dragons should be bigger than a horse. I'd say as big as the ender dragon. You could make these dens quite large as well, then instead of having 2 or 3 dragons in one den, it'd just be one big dragon. They should attack villages too. A new watchtower structure could be added to villages with a bell and a ballista on top to shoot the attacking dragon. The dragon would only attack the village if you entered it with an egg in your inventory. But I love the ideas of the dens! They should be filled with gold too and be quite rare.
we have pufferfish in the game and they act like eels
I had a very similar idea. I like it. The page took my idea doesn't beacuse you beat me to it. Only thing I added was that the electric eel also emitted a redstone signal. Thoughts ?

sad thing is Minecraft wants to add zero real hostile mobs so they only want fantasy hostile mobs like zombies and they don't want to add stuff like sharks or snakes. They said they will never add a hostile mob that exists in the real world
Fact: Electric eels are NOT eels but knife fish instead.
Eels could be a neutral mob that spawns in coral reefs, simply hunting tropical fish there. If provoked/hit, it would attack the player.
It should be a big quadruped creature with a big mouth. It could change from deep to high pitched sound blasts.
I really think that this is a pretty good idea becoming because adding this animal would make the game more realistic
